```{r}

library(tidyverse)

Input =("
State Pet Number
Illinois Dogs 1627
Indiana Dogs 989
Iowa Dogs 407
Illinois Cats 1321
Indiana Cats 852
Iowa Cats 370
")

df = read.table(textConnection(Input),header=TRUE)

ggplot(df, aes(State, Number, color="black")) + 
  geom_bar(stat="identity", position= position_dodge(width = 0.5), alpha = .2)

ggplot(df, aes(State, Number, fill = Pet))+
  geom_histogram(stat="identity", position= position_dodge(width = 0.5), alpha = .9)

df %>%
group_by(Pet) %>%
summarize(pet_sd = sd(Number))




```

```{r}
df %>% 
  summarize(pet_sd = sd(Number))
```

```{r}
df %>% group_by(Pet) %>% summarize(pet_mean = mean(Number))
```

```{r}

State Pet Number
Illinois Dogs 1627

Indiana Cats 852

")
```

```{r}
Input =("
State         Dogs  Cats
Illinois      1627  1321
Indiana        989   852
Iowa           407   370
Maryland       667   645
Michigan      1318  1192
Minnesota      690   643
Nebraska       240   222
New_Jersey    1028   803
Ohio          1708  1553
Pennsylvania  1702  1748
Wisconsin      796   776
        ")

df = read.table(textConnection(Input),header=TRUE)

ggplot(df, aes(x=Dogs, y=Cats)) +
  geom_point(color="red") + 
  geom_smooth(method=lm, se=FALSE, fullrange=TRUE, color = "lightblue") +
  theme_classic()
```
```{r}
ggplot(df, aes(x=Dogs, y=Cats)) +
geom_point(color="red") +
geom_smooth(method = 'loess', se=FALSE, fullrange=TRUE, color="yellow") +
theme_classic()
```

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
URL <-"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2018/2018-09-11/cats_vs_dogs.csv"
df<-read_csv(URL)

df<-df %>% 
  filter(state %in% c("Indiana", "Illinois", "Iowa", "Wisconsin"))
df<-df %>% 
  select(state, n_dog_households,n_cat_households )

df<-df %>% rename(State = state, Dogs=n_dog_households, Cats=n_cat_households )

df<-mutate(df, Pets = Dogs + Cats)

df

df<-transmute(df, Pets = Dogs + Cats)

df
```

```{r}
## create the data shown in the question
#########################################
library(tidyverse)
URL <-"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2018/2018-09-11/cats_vs_dogs.csv"
df<-read_csv(URL)

df<-df %>% 
  filter(state %in% c("Indiana", "Illinois", "Iowa", "Wisconsin"))
df<-df %>% 
  select(state, n_dog_households,n_cat_households )

df<-df %>% rename(State = state, Dogs=n_dog_households, Cats=n_cat_households )
#########################################

# the R code in the question
##############################

df <- transmute(df, Dogdetrend = Dogs - mean(Dogs, na.rm = TRUE), 
          Catsdetrend = Cats - mean(Cats, na.rm = TRUE))

df
```
